alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 27 at 11:11AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated previous heavy rain due to showers. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding will occur along McMullen and Little Sugar Creeks. McMullen Creek will approach Addison Drive, but remains within banks. Along Little Sugar Creek, Freedom Park walkways may begin to flood and East Boulevard Parking Lot may begin to flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
